column1: São Sebastião do Caí is a city near Porto Alegre in the state of Rio Grande do Sul. It has a population of about 25
column2: 000 inhabitants. The principal university is the University of Caxias do Sul
column3: often abbreviated as UCS. Through the middle of the city runs the river Caí
column4: whose source is in the mountains of São Francisco de Paula
column5: and which empties into Guaíba Lake. The city was founded on May 1
column6: 1875. Like many towns in the state which were settled by German-speaking Europeans in the 19th century
column7: the German language is still present in daily family and community life
column8: if not as much in the public sphere since World War II.
